2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
> [test3456](#comment_2_1JuH625YcbVeN6ve7xDXVUkVcoRHgYU8rh): HI yes is see your message could take a second and test my site? [...]

Your site doesn't load. It says "No peers found". You need to seed your site longer for this to have a chance to work.

> [test3456](#comment_4_1JuH625YcbVeN6ve7xDXVUkVcoRHgYU8rh): if my port is closed, (I cant open it). would that prevent people from downloading my site? [...]

Yes and Yes. Personally, for me Zeronet won't work at all if I don't use Tor. It is advised to use Tor by default anyways.

> [test3456](#comment_3_1JuH625YcbVeN6ve7xDXVUkVcoRHgYU8rh): i have been up all day.... any thoughts on what to check?

Whatever you changed, your site seems to work now...

> [test3456](#comment_5_1JuH625YcbVeN6ve7xDXVUkVcoRHgYU8rh): I have switched over to Tor, Could you test the Site again?

It says.
> Thanks to everyone that helped to Test this site!!!!!.
It seems to work now.

> [test3456](#comment_6_1JuH625YcbVeN6ve7xDXVUkVcoRHgYU8rh): Also to note since i have switched to Tor, I have noticed peers on the other site i activated have increased to a couple hundred now.  [...]

I have zeromail but no zerosite yet.

1606040168_1AkCd6161a4erMEbe4998aX7Hnpd2.body:
I have Zeronet running on a headless Raspberry Pi. I can use it from every device that has a browser as long as I am in my home network.
For access outside your home network you could consider using a Tor service just like I do for ssh access. But I normally don't need Zeronet outside of my home network.

> [test3456](#comment_10_1JuH625YcbVeN6ve7xDXVUkVcoRHgYU8rh): Interesting never thought, making my PI available over TOR hidden service, cause then i could access it from anywhere as long as i can connect to Tor.... [...]

It is really simple. Just google it. First search result worked ok for me:
https://www.techrepublic.com/article/how-to-run-an-ssh-connection-through-tor/

1605258725_1EQvG7tmmrK7rvVPaXm9zFeHckdhP.body:
> [sudoroot64](#comment_15_18RoaAqHB6LgsbrRvZuzWrcd33dZkjAfuG): But what happens when you turn your computer off. I think he is trying to create a server that runs 24/7 irregardless of the status of his main machine. I would use at least a Raspberry Pi 3 A+ though.

Indeed Raspberry Pi zero won't cut it performance wise. I replaced my Raspi 2 with the Pi 3 to make it work.

1606985120_19mYz8QAzpKevxXrku9vV6WoQN7cP.body:
I2P/onion can technically be censored if the hosts are captured.
Zeronet is 100% uncensurable for every content that is even only moderately popular.
